play.title: All's Well That Ends Well
play.description: A comedy about a determined woman who pursues the man she loves, navigating themes of class, deception, and reconciliation.

play.title: As You Like It
play.description: A pastoral comedy in which characters flee to the Forest of Arden, exploring love, identity, and transformation.

play.title: The Comedy of Errors
play.description: A farcical tale of two sets of twins separated at birth, leading to misunderstandings, chaos, and eventual reunion.

play.title: Love's Labor's Lost
play.description: Four noblemen vow to avoid women and devote themselves to study, only to have their plans overturned by love.

play.title: Measure for Measure
play.description: A dark comedy exploring justice, morality, and hypocrisy as a ruler tests the virtue of his subjects.

play.title: The Merchant of Venice
play.description: A complex comedy involving debt, justice, mercy, and the famous bond between Antonio and Shylock.

play.title: The Merry Wives of Windsor
play.description: Falstaff attempts to court two married women for money, only to become the target of their humorous schemes.

play.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
play.description: A magical comedy involving fairies, lovers, and mistaken identities set in an enchanted forest.

play.title: Much Ado About Nothing
play.description: A witty battle of words between Beatrice and Benedick unfolds alongside plots of deception and romance.

play.title: Pericles, Prince of Tyre
play.description: A romantic adventure following Prince Pericles as he journeys across the Mediterranean facing trials and loss.

play.title: The Taming of the Shrew
play.description: A controversial comedy about courtship, marriage, and social expectations as Petruchio attempts to "tame" Katherina.

play.title: The Tempest
play.description: Prospero uses magic to orchestrate justice and reconciliation on a remote island after years of exile.

play.title: Twelfth Night
play.description: Viola disguises herself as a man, leading to mistaken identities, love triangles, and comic confusion.

play.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
play.description: Two friends fall in love with the same woman, testing loyalty, friendship, and forgiveness.

play.title: The Two Noble Kinsmen
play.description: Two cousins become rivals for the same woman after swearing eternal friendship.

play.title: The Winter's Tale
play.description: A late romance blending tragedy and comedy, following King Leontes’s destructive jealousy, the loss and miraculous recovery of his family, and a final scene of forgiveness symbolized through the play’s famous “living statue.”

play.title: Lucrece
play.description: A narrative poem recounting the tragic story of Lucrece, whose assault by Sextus Tarquin leads to her suicide and ultimately sparks the overthrow of the Roman monarchy. The poem explores themes of honor, political abuse of power, and the psychological aftermath of violence.

play.title: The Phoenix and Turtle
play.description: An allegorical poem mourning the mystical union and death of the Phoenix and the Turtle Dove, symbolizing perfect but impossible love. The work is dense, metaphysical, and often interpreted as a meditation on truth, unity, and spiritual transcendence.

play.title: Sonnets
play.description: Shakespeare published a book title "Shakespeare's Sonnets", which included 154 sonnets exploring themes of love, mortality, the passage of time, beauty, and infidelity.

play.title: Antony and Cleopatra
play.description: The political and romantic turmoil between Mark Antony and Cleopatra leads to betrayal, conflict, and tragedy.

play.title: Coriolanus
play.description: A Roman general's pride and refusal to appease the people results in his downfall.

play.title: Cymbeline
play.description: A tale of jealousy, mistaken identities, and reconciliation set in ancient Britain.

play.title: Hamlet
play.description: Prince Hamlet seeks revenge for his father’s murder, confronting madness, betrayal, and existential doubt.

play.title: Julius Caesar
play.description: The conspiracy to assassinate Caesar sparks political turmoil and the downfall of his killers.

play.title: King Lear
play.description: A king’s decision to divide his kingdom between his daughters leads to betrayal, madness, and tragedy.

play.title: Macbeth
play.description: Ambition and prophecy drive Macbeth toward murder, tyranny, and inevitable destruction.

play.title: Othello
play.description: Iago’s manipulation destroys Othello’s trust and marriage, leading to jealousy and tragedy.

play.title: Romeo and Juliet
play.description: Two young lovers from feuding families fall into a doomed romance defined by passion and fate.

play.title: Timon of Athens
play.description: A wealthy man becomes a misanthrope after being betrayed by false friends and losing his fortune.

play.title: Titus Andronicus
play.description: A violent revenge tragedy involving betrayal, political conflict, and cycles of vengeance.

play.title: Troilus and Cressida
play.description: A cynical retelling of the Trojan War focusing on a doomed romance amid political and moral corruption.

play.title: Henry IV, Part 1
play.description: Prince Hal navigates rebellion and responsibility while Falstaff provides comic contrast.

play.title: Henry IV, Part 2
play.description: Prince Hal faces political upheaval and matures as he prepares to become king.

play.title: Henry V
play.description: King Henry V leads England during the Hundred Years’ War, culminating in the Battle of Agincourt.

play.title: Henry VI, Part 1
play.description: The early reign of Henry VI unfolds as England loses ground in France and internal conflict grows.

play.title: Henry VI, Part 2
play.description: Political rivalries worsen, setting the stage for the Wars of the Roses.

play.title: Henry VI, Part 3
play.description: The civil war between the houses of York and Lancaster intensifies with shifting power and violence.

play.title: Henry VIII
play.description: A dramatization of Henry VIII’s political maneuvering, marriages, and the rise of Anne Boleyn.

play.title: King John
play.description: King John’s turbulent reign features political intrigue, war, and disputed succession.

play.title: Richard II
play.description: The fall of Richard II and the rise of Henry Bolingbroke mark a turning point in English monarchy.

play.title: Richard III
play.description: Richard’s ruthless ambition drives him to seize the crown, ultimately leading to his defeat.
